basics.name: Yuanqiu(Zoe) Tan
basics.label: PhD student
basics.summary: Ph.D. Candidate in Electrical Engineering with expertise in semiconductor device design, 2D materials integration, and advanced nanofabrication. Proven track record in developing scalable diffusion barriers, ultra-scaled FETs, and spintronic devices, delivering energy-efficient solutions for next-generation electronics.

Teaching.name: ECE department, Purdue University
Teaching.summary: Supervising undergraduate students in MOS fabrication, NV center sensing, and heterostructure design.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
